name: Muslim Community Center Chicago
mission: TEACHING AND RECITATION OF HOLY QURAN, FULL TIME SCHOOL, DAILY AND FRIDAY CONGRGATION, FUNERAL AND MARRIAGE SERVICES, AND CHILDREN AND ADULT EDUCATION.

evaluationSources: Greener Morton Grove Award (Morton Grove Economic Development Commission)

zakatClaimEvidence: The Muslim Community Center Chicago explicitly accepts zakat donations, as evidenced by their dedicated 'Rehab & Welfare/ Zakat Request' section, an 'Online Zakat Form', and the statement that their projects include 'overseeing zakat requests and distributions'. They also provide an email address for zakat inquiries: zakat@mccchicago.org. Furthermore, their website details 'What is Zakah?' and its importance in Islam. (Source: https://mccchicago.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/MCC-Voting-Results-2025.pdf)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Community Center Incorporate shows moderate alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The Muslim Community Center Chicago explicitly accepts zakat donations, as evidenced by their dedicated 'Rehab & Welfare/ Zakat Request' section, an 'Online Zakat Form', and the statement that their projects include 'overseeing zakat requests and distributions'. They also provide an email address for zakat inquiries: zakat@mccchicago.org. Furthermore, their website details 'What is Zakah?' and its importance in Islam. (Source: https://mccchicago.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/MCC-Voting-Results-2025.pdf)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported total revenue of $9,945,910, a 93.4% program expense ratio, and provides religious and educational services.
Financial metadata confirms the organization's working capital of 23.6 months and fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised.
Organizational data confirms the center's role in community governance and its focus on religious programming.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and provides various donation options for religious and community support.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate score due to its excellent financial efficiency and Zakat eligibility, balanced against a lack of detailed impact evidence and lower data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external data regarding specific program outcomes and long-term impact metrics.
Low data confidence score suggests a need for increased transparency in public reporting.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 25/50, the charity offers a medium fit for donors seeking to support established religious infrastructure and cultural preservation [3]. Its Zakat-eligible status and long-standing provision of funeral and marriage services align with core communal needs, though the urgency is categorized as religious-cultural rather than emergency-based [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a moderate impact score of 20/50, primarily focused on capacity building through its full-time school and religious education programs [1][3]. While it maintains a high program expense ratio of 93.4%, there is limited third-party verification or cost-per-beneficiary data available to confirm broader effectiveness [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim Community Center Incorporate serves the Chicago community through comprehensive religious education, social services, and congregational support.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 93.4%, indicating the vast majority of funds directly support community services.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.03 to raise every $1.
Strong liquidity position with 23.6 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim Community Center Incorporate (MCC) is a Zakat-eligible organization dedicated to the teaching and recitation of the Holy Quran, operating a full-time school and providing essential community services [1][3]. With a total revenue of $9,945,910, the organization facilitates daily congregations, marriage services, and funeral rites for the local Muslim population [1][2].
